subject: participant id
TrialNumber: trial number within the current run, from 1 to 60
image_path: path to image file within data repository

condition.seen: the image has either been shown during the previous session (scan) or it is being repeated within the current session
condition.unseen: the image has never at any time been shown to the participant

image_nr: number attributed to the image within the current task dataset, from 1 to ~8634
category_nr: number attributed to the image's category within the current task dataset, from 1-720
exemplar_nr: number given to the examplar within its category, from 1-6
things_category_nr: number attributed to the image within the THINGS dataset from which it originates, from 1-1854
things_image_nr: number attributed to the image's category within the THINGS dataset, from 1 to ~26100
things_exemplar_nr: number given to the examplar within its category within the THINGS dataset, from 1-6

subcondition.unseen-between: image has never been shown, WILL be shown a 2nd time during the NEXT session(fMRI scan), ~1 week later
subcondition.unseen-within: image has never been shown, WILL be shown a 2nd time during the CURRENT fMRI session
subcondition.seen-between: image was shown to the participant once before during the PREVIOUS session (~1 week ago)
subcondition.seen-within: image was shown to the participant once before during the CURRENT session
subcondition.seen-within-between: image was shown twice WITHIN the previous session (~1 week ago), is shown for the 3rd time during the current session
subcondition.seen-between-within: image was first shown (once) during the previous session (~1 week ago), it was shown a second time during the current session, and is now shown for the third time

repetition: the number of times an image has been shown (including current)
onset: time since scanner onset in seconds
duration: time during which the image is shown, in seconds
response_mapping_flip_h: whether the button-to-response mapping was flipped horizontally for this trial, True or False (to counterbalance motor response)
response_mapping_flip_v: whether the button-to-response mapping was flipped vertically for this trial, True or False
onset flip: exact time at which the image was 'flipped' (appeared on screen w psychopy), in seconds
offset_flip: exact time at which the image was 'flipped' offscreen (disappeared from screen w psychopy), in seconds
keypresses: list of recorded button presses during current trial (a, b, x and y); the FIRST recorded answer is considered as the trial's answer (to assess RT and accuracy)
response: participant answer, derived by mapping the recorded key press with the trial's response mapping (flipped or not); 2 = seen, confident; 1 = seen, not confident; -1 = unseen, not confident; -2 unseen, condident
response_txt: participant's mapping of button press to behavioural response. 'Seen' = the image has been shown before; 'unseen' = 'the image is shown for the first time'
error: True = the participant's response (seen / unseen) does not correspond to the condition; False (no error) = the participant's response corresponds to the condition
response_confidence: True = the participant gave their answer (seen / unseen) with high confidence; False = the participant gave their answer with low confidence
response_time: Time in seconds between the image onset ('onset') and the first recorded button press
duration_flip: difference between 'offset_flip' and 'onset_flip (real duration of shown image)'
order: order in which the images were presented within the current fMRI run, from 0
session_trial_time: logged computer clock time for each trial
atypical: boolean flag indicates trials whose entries required relabelling (e.g., condition unseen -> seen) because it was shown out of the pre-planned order
atypical_log: logged details about what corrections/relabelling were applied to a trial entry; default is empty (no logged issue)
exclude_session: boolean flag. True indicates sessions with trial conditions altered due to sessions being administered out of order. We recommend not to include these sessions in analyses of memory effects (e.g., atypical number of image repetitions), but these sessions are appropriate to study image and concept representations in the brain.
delay_days: for 2nd and 3rd image showings, number of days elapsed since the image was last shown. 0.0 indicates within-session repetitions
delay_seconds: for within-session repetitions (2nd and 3rd showings), number of seconds elapsed since the image was last shown. 0.0 indicates between-session repetitions for which delays are expressed in days rather than seconds
trials_since_lastrep: for 2nd and 3rd image showings, number of trials (image shown) since the image was last shown
